arundel.util

Interface Function

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Add, Constant, Multiply, Negation, Reciprocal

    public interface Function
    Interface for abstracting the concept of mathematical functions. A function essentiallly operates on a set of inputs and returns an output. It also has a property called derivative which denotes its rate of change with the change in one of its parameters. Also, for implementation purposes we also specify the number of inputs that a Function needs to operate.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double[] derivatives(double... parameters)
      Returns the partial derivatives of this function with respect to its parameters as an array of Function
      int noOfInputs()
      Returns the no of inputs that this function needs.
      double operate(double... parameters)
      Operates on the given set of inputs and returns the result of the operation.

    • Method Detail

      • noOfInputs

        int noOfInputs()
        Returns the no of inputs that this function needs.
        Returns:
        the number of inputs required.

      • operate

        double operate(double... parameters)
        Operates on the given set of inputs and returns the result of the operation. This is the elixir of the concept of functions.
        Parameters:
        parameters - to be operated on
        Returns:
        the result of the operation or Double.NaN if expected number of parameters is not found (if it matters).

      • derivatives

        double[] derivatives(double... parameters)
        Returns the partial derivatives of this function with respect to its parameters as an array of Function
        Parameters:
        parameters - point of tangency
        Returns:
        array of partial derivative values, null if the expected no of parameters is not found
